laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count, hematocrit, hemoglobin level, blood levels of electrolytes, glucose, and thyrotropin were normal. Kidney-function and liver-function tests were normal; a test for Lyme disease was negative.
Antinuclear antibodies were present at a titer of 1:40 with a speckled pattern.
Glucose: 66 mg/dL, Total protein: 33 mg/dL, Total nucleated cells: 1 per mm3 (59% lymphocytes, 41% monocytes). Color was colorless, turbidity was clear, and xanthochromia was not present.

T2-weighted FLAIR imaging showed minimal confluent periventricular signal hyperintensity and scattered focal subcortical signal hyperintensity in both cerebral hemispheres, with mild ventricular prominence.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At the second admission (three weeks after first), MRI showed mild signal hyperintensity in the bilateral basal ganglia and thalami that was most conspicuous in the caudate nuclei.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total tau level was greater than 4000 pg/mL (reference range, 0 to 1149).
Single sharp wave in the left parietal region but otherwise normal.
